The Demon Queen Awakens.name: 《恶魔女王的崛起》
The Demon Queen Awakens.description:
Over a thousand years ago the Demon Queen, Nehebkelat, and her four dread generals ruled an empire that spanned a continent. Her tyranny was opposed by an ancient and noble order, the Eyes of Aten, who after a century of terrible conflict defeated the dread generals and cast down the Demon Queen, imprisoning her for a thousand years. Those thousand years have now passed and the ancient order of protectors who imprisoned the Demon Queen has been lost to time.

In The Demon Queen Awakens, the player characters represent the only heroes willing to assist the last surviving member of the Eyes of Aten - charged with the sacred duty of preventing Nehebkelat from escaping her prison. Upon entering the Vault of Aten, the heroes will realize this is no easy task. Dark forces have awoken to ensure that Nehebkelat will rise again and subjugate the continent beneath her abyssal rule.
The Demon Queen Awakens.caption: 一款专为FVTT设计的5版冒险模组。

Shield Slam.name: 盾牌猛击
Shield Slam.description:
近战武器攻击:命中+9, 触及5尺, 一个目标。命中：8 (2d6 + 5) 钝击伤害。

如果目标是一个体型至多为大型的生物，它必须成功通过一个DC 15 力量豁免，否则将被推后5尺。

腐化乌沙比特用它的盾牌攻击。如果目标是不大于大型体型的生物，它必须进行一次力量豁免。

Siphon.name: 虹吸
Siphon.description:
每当一个法术被施放时，腐化乌沙比特身上的符文便会发出明亮的光芒，并开始贪婪地收集魔法能量。

任何时候，只要在腐化乌沙比特30尺范围内施放法术，它就会恢复2点生命值，生命值恢复量等于2乘以法术的环阶（戏法算作1环）。

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: 被腐化的乌沙比特发动两次攻击，一次使用盾牌，一次使用长剑。

Parry.name: 格挡
Parry.description: 被腐化的乌沙比特在被一次近战攻击命中时，其AC加上 2。此时该乌沙比特必须能看见攻击者，且有在持用一把近战武器或一面盾牌。

Khopesh Slash.name: 克赫帕什镰形刀斩击
Khopesh Slash.description:
近战武器攻击：+9 命中， 触及 5 尺， 单一目标。命中：11 (2d8 + 5) 挥砍伤害。

腐化乌沙比特用它锋利的刀锋攻击。

Multiattack.description: 木乃伊可以先使用恐怖凝视然后再用腐朽拳击攻击。

Rotting Fist.name: 腐朽拳击
Rotting Fist.description:
近战武器攻击： 命中 +5，触及 5 尺，单一目标。命中：10（2d6+3）点钝击伤害，外加 10（3d6）点暗蚀伤害。

如果目标是生物，则目标必须成功通过一次 DC 12 的体质豁免，否则将承受木乃伊的腐烂诅咒。被诅咒目标不能恢复生命值，且该诅咒每持续 24 小时其生命值上限将降低 10（3d6）。如果诅咒使目标的生命值上限降至 0，则该目标死亡，且其尸体化作尘土。该诅咒效应持续直至被法术移除诅咒 Remove Curse 或其他魔法移除。

木乃伊发动腐朽拳击，如果目标为生物，它必须进行一次体质豁免。

Dreadful Glare.name: 恐怖怒视
Dreadful Glare.description:
木乃伊指定自身 60 尺范围内一个它能看见的生物。如果目标生物可以看到木乃伊，则该生物必须成功通过一次 DC 11 的感知豁免以抵抗该魔法，豁免失败则目标生物受恐慌，其效应持续至该木乃伊的下一个回合结束。

若目标生物豁免失败且差值为 5 或更高，则目标生物同时陷入麻痹。豁免成功的生物在接下来的 24 小时免疫所有木乃伊（除了木乃伊领主）的恐怖凝视。

木乃伊指定自身 60 尺范围内一个它能看见的生物。如果目标生物可以看到木乃伊，则该生物必须成功通过一次感知豁免以抵抗该魔法。

Detect Evil and Good.name: 侦测善恶
Detect Evil and Good.description:
你在法术持续时间内能感觉到身边 30 尺内出现的任一异怪、天界生物、元素生物、精类生物、邪魔或不死生物的存在，并掌握其具体位置。另外，你也可以知晓 30 尺内的物件或地点是否被祝福或亵渎。

该法术可以穿透大多障碍，但仍会被 1 尺厚石质或 1 寸厚金属质，或一层薄铅质，或 3 尺厚木质或泥质材料阻隔。

Detect Magic.name: 侦测魔法
Detect Magic.description: 你在法术持续时间内能感测到 30 尺内存在的魔法。感测到魔法的存在后，你可以使用动作，来看到任何你能看见的具有魔法的生物或物件周围环绕着微弱的灵光，并分辨出其所属的魔法学派（若有）。该法术可以穿透大部分障碍，但仍会被 1 尺厚石质，或 1 寸厚金属质，或一层薄铅质，或 3 尺厚木质或泥质材料阻隔。

Detect Thoughts.name: 侦测思想
Detect Thoughts.description:
你激活下述效应之一。直到法术结束为止，你可以在你随后的回合用一个魔法动作以激活下述任意效应之一。

感知思想。 你感知距你 30 尺内，知晓语言或能够心灵感应的思想的存在。你并不会阅读这些思想，但你知道这里存在一名有理智的生物。

此法术会被 1 尺厚的岩石、泥土或木头，1 寸厚的金属，或薄薄一层铅阻隔。

阅读思想。 选择一名距你 30 尺内的可见生物，或一名距你 30 尺内被感知思想侦测到的生物。你了解到此时目标最关心的事情。如果目标不知晓任何语言也不会心灵感应，则你不能得到任何信息。

在你的下一回合，用一个魔法动作，你可以尝试深入目标的心灵。如果你选择这么做，目标进行一次感知豁免。豁免失败，则你了解到他的逻辑推理、情绪状态以及他头脑中的一些大事（比如忧虑、挚爱和仇恨的事物）。豁免成功，法术终止。无论哪种情况，目标都会知道你正在窥探其心灵，且直到你的注意力从它的心灵上移开为止，目标均可以在其回合内使用动作进行一次 [[/check ability=int skill=arc dc=@attributes.spelldc]] 检定，对抗你的法术豁免DC，目标胜出对抗时，法术终止。

Bless.name: 祝福术
Bless.description:
你用言语祝福施法距离内至多三个生物。在法术终止前，每当受术目标进行攻击检定或豁免检定时，可以额外掷一次 d4 并加在其结果上。

升环施法：使用二环或更高法术位施展该法术时，你使用的法术位每比一环高一环，就可以多指定一个目标。

Create Food and Water.name: 造粮术
Create Food and Water.description: 你在施法距离内的地面或容器上创造 45 磅的食物和 30 加仑的水，其总量可以满足十五个类人生物或者五匹坐骑 24 小时的补给需求。食物非常清淡但营养丰富，并且如果 24 小时内不食用即会变坏。创造的水清洁可饮用且不会以该方式变质。

Cure Wounds.name: 疗伤术
Cure Wounds.description:
一个你触碰的生物恢复特定数值的生命值，其恢复量等于 1d8 + 你的施法属性调整值。该法术对不死生物和构装生物无效。

升环施法：使用二环或更高法术位施展该法术时，你使用的法术位每比一环高一环，恢复量就增加 1d8。

Lesser Restoration.name: 次级复原术
Lesser Restoration.description: 你触碰一个生物，并终止正影响它的一种状态：&Reference[blinded]、&Reference[deafened]、&Reference[paralyzed] 或 &Reference[poisoned]。

Sanctuary.name: 庇护术
Sanctuary.description:
你的法术保护一个施法距离内的生物不受攻击。在法术终止前，任何试图对受保护者进行攻击或对受保护者施放伤害性法术的生物都必须进行一次感知豁免。豁免失败则该生物必须选定一个新目标，否则将失去本次的攻击或法术。该法术不能保护受术者免受范围效应（如爆炸或火球）的影响。

若受保护生物发动一次攻击，施展一道影响敌人的法术，或是对任何其他生物造成伤害，则该法术随之终止。

Shield.name: 盾牌
Shield.description: 一道看不见的力场制护盾浮现在你身旁，保护着你。在你的下一回合开始前，你的 AC 具有 +5 加值（在触发该法术的攻击之前生效），并且不会受到魔法飞弹magic missile的伤害。

activation.condition: 被攻击命中，或被“魔法飞弹”法术指定为目标时，你可以使用该法术。

Dream.name: 托梦术
Dream.description:
此法术塑造一个生物的梦境。选择一个你所认识的生物作为法术目标。该目标必须与你在同一存在位面。不睡觉的生物，例如精灵，无法被该法术影响。你，或一个你所接触的自愿生物，进入一种恍惚状态，扮演信使的角色。在恍惚状态下，信使能感知其周围环境，但不能采取动作或移动。

如果目标已睡着，信使将出现在目标的梦境中，并且只要目标保持睡眠状态，信使便可在法术持续时间内与目标交谈。信使还可以塑造梦境环境，创造风景、物体和其他景象。信使可以在任何时候脱离恍惚状态，提前结束法术效果。目标醒来后能完美地回忆起梦境。如果施法时目标是清醒的，信使会知道这一点，并可以选择结束恍惚状态（及法术），或者等待目标入睡，届时信使将出现在目标的梦境中。

你可以让信使以一个可怖且吓人的形态出现在目标面前。如果你这么做，信使可以传递不超过十个词的信息，然后目标必须进行一次感知豁免。豁免失败，幻象怪物的回响会生成一个噩梦，持续目标睡眠的整个时间，并使目标无法从这次休息中获得任何益处。此外，当目标醒来时，它会受到3d6心灵伤害。

如果你拥有目标身体的一部分，如一缕头发、一片指甲或类似的身体部分，则目标进行豁免时处于劣势。

materials.value: 一把沙子、一滴墨水，以及一根从睡着的鸟身上拔下的羽毛笔

Greater Restoration.name: 高等复原术
Greater Restoration.description:
你为一个触碰到的生物灌注正能量来解除一项弱化效应。你可以使目标的力竭等级降低一级，或者选择终止目标身上的下列效应之一：

  • 一项影响目标的魅惑或石化效应
  • 一项诅咒，包括目标与一件被诅咒魔法物品的同调
  • 对目标某项属性值的减损
  • 一项降低目标生命值上限的效应

materials.value: 价值至少100gp的钻石粉末，法术会消耗掉它

Scrying.name: 探知
Scrying.description:
你能看见和听见一个和你处于同一存在位面上的生物。目标生物必须进行一次 感知 豁免；该豁免的调整值与你对目标的了解程度有关，也与你和目标之间的物理联系程度有关。如果目标知道你在施展该法术，而它又愿意被你观察，则它可以自愿放弃该豁免。

了解程度 豁免调整值
二手信息（你曾经听说过目标） +5
直接信息（你曾经见过目标） +0
熟悉（你对目标很了解） -5
你持有目标的… 豁免调整值
肖像或其他图像 -2
衣物或其他物品 -4
身体部位如头发或指甲 -10

如果对方豁免成功，则目标不受该法术影响，并且在 24 小时内你不能尝试探知同一个目标。

如果对方豁免失败，则你在目标身边 10 尺内创造出一个隐形的传感器。通过传感器，你可以身临其境地看见和听见周围的环境。传感器会跟随目标移动，并在法术持续时间内始终保持在目标 10 尺之内。在能够看破隐形的生物眼中，你的探传感器是一个拳头大小的光球。

除生物之外，你也可以选择一个你以前见过的地点作为该法术的目标。这时，传感器会出现在目标地点且不会移动。

materials.value: 一个价值至少1,000 gp的法器，例如一个水晶球、一面银镜或一个装满圣水的圣坛。

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description:
Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit,, 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) piercing damage.

The target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 24 hours. Until this poison ends, the target is unconscious. Another creature can use an action to shake the target awake.

Uraeus attacks with her Bite. The target must make a Constitution saving throw.

Constrict.name: Constrict
Constrict.description:
Melee Weapon Attack:+6 to hit,, 10 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

The target is grappled (escape DC 15). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the couatl can't constrict another target.

Uraeus' attacks with her Constrict. The target is grappled. Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and she can't constrict another target.

Protection from Poison.name: Protection from Poison
Protection from Poison.description:
You touch a creature. If it is poisoned, you neutralize the poison. If more than one poison afflicts the target, you neutralize one poison that you know is present, or you neutralize one at random.

For the duration, the target has advantage on saving throws against being poisoned, and it has resistance to poison damage.

Spit Fire.name: Spit Fire
Spit Fire.description:
Recharge on 5-6

Uraeus spits divine fire a a creature within 30 feet. It and any hostile creatures adjacent to it take 10 (3d6) fire damage, or half damage with a successful DC 13 Dexterity saving throw.

Uraeus spits divine fire from her mouth which explodes when it hits her foe if they fail a Dexterity saving throw.

Abasi the Undaunted.name: Abasi the Undaunted
Abasi the Undaunted.description:
Abasi is tall, broad shouldered, and muscular. His garb is simple, and light with no more armor than necessary to protect him. Though once bald and clean-shaven, a few day's growth of gray hair now betray his age. 

A network of scars cuts through his darkly tanned and weather worn skin, down his cheek, to neck and shoulders. It seems that this aging warrior's life has seen no shortage of battle, but unlike most who break under the stress of constant danger, he does not appear the least bit diminished by such trials. His eyes are the color of the morning dawn, and his gaze is stern. 

At rest he is still, with the patient bearing of a hawk watching for prey.

To learn more about Abasi's history, personality, and knowledge see @UUID[JournalEntry.cmqoF8Cq3mEIsGPA.JournalEntryPage.V3dAx6jB90lekomS]{Biography: Abasi the Undaunted}.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description: Spellcasting. Abasi is a 5th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks) and he can prepare Ranger spells.

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: Abasi makes two melee attacks, one with his Quarterstaff of Aten and another with his Ceremonial Khopesh.

Guided Strike.name: Guided Strike
Guided Strike.description: Abasi grants a +10 bonus to an attack roll made by himself or another creature within 30 feet of him. He can make this choice after the roll is made but before the attack is fully resolved.

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn't being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Sacred Flame.name: Sacred Flame
Sacred Flame.description:
Flame-like radiance descends on a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d8 Radiant damage. The target gains no benefit from Half Cover or Three-Quarters Cover for this save.

Cantrip Upgrade. The damage increases by 1d8 when you reach levels 5 (2d8), 11 (3d8), and 17 (4d8).

Desert Ranger's Leathers.name: Desert Ranger's Leathers
Desert Ranger's Leathers.description: A well-worn suit of magically reinforced leather armor that is emblazoned with holy sigils of the Eyes of Aten.

Ceremonial Khopesh.name: Ceremonial Khopesh
Ceremonial Khopesh.description:
Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage.

An intricately detailed curved sword emblazoned with holy sigils of the Eyes of Aten.

Quarterstaff of Aten.name: Quarterstaff of Aten
Quarterstaff of Aten.description:
Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

An ornate quarterstaff ending in a large golden crystal which emanates dim light in a 15 foot radius.

Relic of the Order. Using his quarterstaff, Abasi may perform the following Cantrips.

  • Sacred Flame
  • Light

Longstrider.name: Longstrider
Longstrider.description:
You touch a creature. The target's Speed increases by 10 feet until the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Longstrider.name: Longstrider
Longstrider.description: The target’s Speed increases by 10 feet until the spell ends.

Detect Magic.name: 侦测魔法
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell's school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Hunter's Mark.name: Hunter's Mark
Hunter's Mark.description:
You magically mark one creature you can see within range as your quarry. Until the spell ends, you deal an extra 1d6 Force damage to the target whenever you hit it with an attack roll. You also have Advantage on any [[/check ability=wis skill=prc]] or [[/check ability=wis skill=sur]] check you make to find it.

If the target drops to 0 Hit Points before this spell ends, you can take a Bonus Action to move the mark to a new creature you can see within range.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. Your Concentration can last longer with a spell slot of level 3–4 (up to 8 hours) or 5+ (up to 24 hours).

Cure Wounds.name: 疗伤术
Cure Wounds.description:
A creature you touch regains a number of Hit Points equal to 2d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The healing increases by 2d8 for each spell slot level above 1.

Lesser Restoration.name: 次级复原术
Lesser Restoration.description: You touch a creature and end one condition on it: &Reference[blinded], &Reference[deafened], &Reference[paralyzed], or &Reference[poisoned].

Locate Object.name: Locate Object
Locate Object.description:
Describe or name an object that is familiar to you. You sense the direction to the object's location if that object is within 1,000 feet of you. If the object is in motion, you know the direction of its movement.

The spell can locate a specific object known to you if you have seen it up close—within 30 feet—at least once. Alternatively, the spell can locate the nearest object of a particular kind, such as a certain kind of apparel, jewelry, furniture, tool, or weapon.

This spell can't locate an object if any thickness of lead blocks a direct path between you and the object.

Pass without Trace.name: Pass without Trace
Pass without Trace.description: You radiate a concealing aura in a 30-foot Emanation for the duration. While in the aura, you and each creature you choose have a +10 bonus to [[/check ability=dex skill=ste]] checks and leave no tracks.

Concealed.name: Concealed
Concealed.description: While in the aura, you and each creature you choose have a +10 bonus to [[/check ability=dex skill=ste]] checks and leave no tracks.

Daylight.name: Daylight
Daylight.description:
For the duration, sunlight spreads from a point within range and fills a 60-foot-radius Sphere. The sunlight's area is Bright Light and sheds Dim Light for an additional 60 feet.

Alternatively, you cast the spell on an object that isn't being worn or carried, causing the sunlight to fill a 60-foot Emanation originating from that object. Covering that object with something opaque, such as a bowl or helm, blocks the sunlight.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of Darkness created by a spell of level 3 or lower, that other spell is dispelled.

Protection from Energy.name: Protection from Energy
Protection from Energy.description: For the duration, the willing creature you touch has Resistance to one damage type of your choice: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder.

Ansubek, The Shadow Beneath.name: Ansubek, The Shadow Beneath
Ansubek, The Shadow Beneath.description:
Toward the rear of the chamber a huge throne is nestled between two outlets noisily spilling water. A massive, hulking form sits atop the throne, one hand toying with the hilt of a great sword. This figure is covered in rough, green hide, has long claws at the ends of his fingertips, and the head of a crocodile.

Ansubek dwells within the Sepulcher of Dawn - his former prison is now a verdant domain. See @UUID[JournalEntry.n6Fb0D0xskxz4zR4.JournalEntryPage.MwQMOshR3SD8Mkan]{1f. The Sepulcher of Dawn} for details on Ansubek's encounter, personality, and tactics.

Hold Breath.name: Hold Breath
Hold Breath.description: Ansubek can hold its breath for up to 15 minutes.

Underwater Camouflage.name: Underwater Camouflage
Underwater Camouflage.description: Ansubek has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made while underwater.

Blood Frenzy.name: Blood Frenzy
Blood Frenzy.description: Ansubek has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that has fewer than half its remaining hit points.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description:
Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, one target. Hit: 12 (1d12 + 6) piercing damage and the targets is Grappled (escape DC 19).

Until this grapple ends, the target is Restrained, and Ansubek can't bite another target.

Ansubek attacks with his massive jaws. A creature caught in his ferocious bite will find themselves Grappled and Restrained until they can escape!

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: Ansubek attacks three times, once with his sword, once with his bite, and once with his claw.

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description:
Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, one target. Hit: 13 (1d8 + 6) slashing damage.

Ansubek lashes out with his reptilian claws.

River Rush.name: River Rush
River Rush.description:
Ansubek moves to any open square in his arena that is filled with water.

If Ansubek used The Shadow Beneath and is hidden, this movement does not provoke opportunity attacks from creatures that cannot perceive him.

Water roils and bubbles as Anubek shifts through the waters of the sepulcher.

Death Roll.name: Death Roll
Death Roll.description:
The target must make a Strength saving throw or suffer (18) 2d12 + 6 piercing damage. On a successful save, the target takes half damage and escapes from Ansubek's jaws.

Ansubek and his target must be in water, and his target must be grappled due to a successful Bite attack.

Ansubek he twists and spins his grappled victim into a terrible death roll.

save.condition: A creature that is grappled by Ansubek

Dreadful Vibration.name: Dreadful Vibration
Dreadful Vibration.description:
Any creature within the same body of water within 120 feet of Ansubek must make a Wisdom save DC 18 or be Frightened until the end of their next turn.

If a creature successfully saves when this power is used they have advantage on all future saves against it in that encounter.

Ansubek partially submerges and unleashes a horrible vibrating roar that pulses through the water.

The Waters Rise.name: The Waters Rise
The Waters Rise.description:
Ansubek causes the room to seal shut and fill with water, making the entire sepulcher underwater. On his turn, Ansubek must expend a Bonus Action to sustain the effect, otherwise the waters recede at the end of Ansubek's turn. If Ansubek is incapacitated, the waters immediately recede.

The chamber doors cannot be reopened until the waters recede. If the doors have been destroyed or jammed open, then this ability cannot be maintained by Ansubek and the waters automatically recede on the end of Ansubek's turn.

Once the water has receded, his ability to use this Lair Action recharges on a 1d6 roll of 4 or greater.

Ansubek calls upon his mastery of the Blade of Rushing Waters, filling the chamber with murky water to the ceiling. This also seals the chamber door shut.

Lurking Danger.name: Lurking Danger
Lurking Danger.description:
Ansubek targets an empty square of water and one creature adjacent to it. The targeted creature must succeed on a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw or take (7) 1d10 + 2 piercing damage and be dragged into the targeted square.

If Ansubek is in water and the creature is moved, Ansubek can instantly travel to an open, adjacent space next to that creature and grapple them as though Ansubek bit them.

Ansubek calls for an elemental crocodile to lunge out of the water at a creature in an attempt to bite and drag them into the water.

The Shadow Beneath.name: The Shadow Beneath
The Shadow Beneath.description:
Ansubek submerges beneath the surface and takes the Hide action with advantage.

Ansubek dives into the water, disappearing completely from view.

Blade of the Rushing Waters.name: Blade of the Rushing Waters
Blade of the Rushing Waters.description:
Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5ft, one target. Hit: 13 (1d8 + 6) slashing damage.

Ansubek wields his massive ceremonial weapon with one hand as though it weighed nothing at all.

Endless Flood.name: Endless Flood
Endless Flood.description:
The effects of The Waters Rise remain in effect until the end of Ansubek's next turn.

Ansubek focuses through the Blade of Rushing Waters and sustains the raging torrent which has risen around him.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If Ansubek fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description:
Ansubek can take 3 legendary actions choosing from the actions below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Ansubek regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.

  • Death Roll (Costs 2 Actions).
  • Dreadful Vibration.
  • River Rush.

Ansubek can take 3 legendary actions.

Anubhet, The Stygian Monolith.name: Anubhet, The Stygian Monolith
Anubhet, The Stygian Monolith.description:
A massive obsidian giant with the head of a jackal and a golden headpiece rests on a giant stone chair. Its eyes burn with a terrible light and smoke from the braziers hung just above its head passively reach tendrils of flame reaching out toward it as smoke crawls across the ceiling of the chamber. Anubhet, the Stygian Monolith turns its head toward you, massive hands claiming a huge spiked shield, and a black sword only a giant could wield.

Anubhet dwells within the Sepulcher of Dusk - his former prison which has now become his fortified throne. See @UUID[JournalEntry.n6Fb0D0xskxz4zR4.JournalEntryPage.6TODq5DKCZxTD8tJ]{1n. The Sepulcher of Dusk} for details on Anubhet's encounter, personality, and tactics.

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: Anubhet attacks twice with the Sword of Death.

Immutable Form.name: Immutable Form
Immutable Form.description: Anhubet is immune to any spell or effect that would alter his form.

Sword of Death.name: Sword of Death
Sword of Death.description:
Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 6) slashing damage and 6 (2d6) necrotic damage. 

This dark stone sword ripples with the necrotic energy as it strikes its victims.

Blade of Unleashed Anger.name: Blade of Unleashed Anger
Blade of Unleashed Anger.description:
Anubhet may only use this ability once the corrupted ushabti named Neser-Sefet is defeated. 

Anubhet makes a single melee attack with its Sword of Death, and deals an additional 2d6  fire damage on a hit. The attack's damage also ignores any damage resistances the target has.

Anubhet raises its blade and channels a portion of the construct's limitless anger into it, causing the weapon to burn with a dark and baleful fire pulled from the underworld.

Calm of Neser-Sefet.name: Calm of Neser-Sefet
Calm of Neser-Sefet.description:
Anubhet has this benefit while Neser-Sefet is alive. If Neser-Sefet is destroyed, disable his Active Effect.

Anubhet has resistance to all damage types.

Wisdom of Neken-Ab.name: Wisdom of Neken-Ab
Wisdom of Neken-Ab.description:
Anubhet has this benefit while Neken-Ab is alive. If Neken-Ab is destroyed, disable his Active Effect.

Anubhet gains a permanent +5 increase to his Armor Class.

Path of Reckless Pain.name: Path of Reckless Pain
Path of Reckless Pain.description:
Anubhet may only use this ability once the corrupted ushabti named Neken-Ab is defeated.

Anubhet lunges forward up to 20 feet in a straight line, moving through the squares of any creatures in the way. Any creature in this path must make a DC 18 Dexterity save.

On success the creature evades Anubhet's charge and may choose to move 5 feet in any direction out of Anubhet's path.

On failure the creature takes 20 (3d10 + 5) Bludgeoning damage and is pushed up to 10 feet along Anubhet's path, and is knocked prone.

Anubhet lunges forward, smashing through all foes in its way.

Shield of the Monolith.name: Shield of the Monolith
Shield of the Monolith.description:
This shield is made of stone and is considered part of Anubhet. It cannot be dropped or taken away.

While holding this shield, you have a bonus to AC of +2. This bonus is in addition to the shield's normal bonus to AC.

Shield Bash.name: Shield Bash
Shield Bash.description:
Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage and 3 (1d6) piercing damage.

The target must also succeed on a DC 18 Strength saving throw, being pushed back 5 ft or knocked prone on failure (Anubhet's choice).

Anubhet slams into a foe with its massive stone tower shield.

Focus of Akh-Medes.name: Focus of Akh-Medes
Focus of Akh-Medes.description:
Anubhet has this benefit while Akh-Medes is alive. If Akh-Medes is destroyed, disable his Active Effect.

Anubhet has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Gaze of Deadly Focus.name: Gaze of Deadly Focus
Gaze of Deadly Focus.description:
Anubet raises surveys his foes as his eyes brim with roiling purple flames. 

Anubhet may only use this ability once the corrupted ushabti named  Akh-Medes is defeated.

He selects up to 3 targets that he can see and fires rays of purple energy from his eyes at them, dealing 1d12 Necrotic damage.

Onyx Wall.name: Onyx Wall
Onyx Wall.description:
Anubhet raises its stone shield in anticipation of attack, deflecting the blow, and causing harm to the attacker.

As a reaction to an incoming melee attack that Anubhet can see, the attacker suffers disadvantage and takes 3 (1d6) piercing damage if their attack misses.

Vision of the Corrupted.name: Vision of the Corrupted
Vision of the Corrupted.description:
Anubhet issues a command to the Corrupted Ushabti then gains the ability to look through their eyes.

Example commands:

  • "Ushabti, what transpires beyond my sight?"
  • "Tell me what you see, my servants."
  • "Ushabti, reveal to me what lies before you."
  • "Give to me your sight, my servants."

If Anubhet sees nothing amiss it responds with: "I see, as you were." or "Very good, return to your watch."

However, if Anubhet sees a player it makes a comment about one of them, or orders the Ushabti to subdue them, and then begins making its way to the group's location.

Anubhet's voice rings out in the chamber, echoing off bare walls, and causing the purple flamed braziers to flash and sputter with each word spoken! The corrupted Ushabti go completely still, their eyes beginning to glow a brilliant pink, casting a pulsing haze of light in front of them.

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description:
Anubhet can take 3 legendary actions. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Anubhet regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

  • Blade of Unleashed Anger
  • Gaze of Deadly Focus (2 actions)
  • Path of Reckless Pain

Anubhet can take 3 legendary actions.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If Anubhet fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

k6vgc36CJ8ociKnp.name: Sword of Death
k6vgc36CJ8ociKnp.description:
This sword is made of stone and is considered part of Anubhet. It cannot be dropped or taken away.

This giant stone blade is made of black material which absorbs nearly all light. It ripples with dark energy. The hilt and handle appears to be painted or plated with gold or brass.

Shield Slam.name: 盾牌猛击
Shield Slam.description:
近战武器攻击:命中+9, 触及5尺, 一个目标。命中：8 (2d6 + 5) 钝击伤害。

如果目标是一个体型至多为大型的生物，它必须成功通过一个DC 15 力量豁免，否则将被推后5尺。

腐化乌沙比特用它的盾牌攻击。如果目标是不大于大型体型的生物，它必须进行一次力量豁免。

Siphon.name: 虹吸
Siphon.description:
每当一个法术被施放时，腐化乌沙比特身上的符文便会发出明亮的光芒，并开始贪婪地收集魔法能量。

任何时候，只要在腐化乌沙比特30尺范围内施放法术，它就会恢复2点生命值，生命值恢复量等于2乘以法术的环阶（戏法算作1环）。

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The Corrupted Ushabti has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Immutable Form.name: Immutable Form
Immutable Form.description: The Corrupted Ushabti is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

Magic Weapons.name: Magic Weapons
Magic Weapons.description: The Corrupted Ushabti's weapon attacks are magical.

Acid Absorption.name: Acid Absorption
Acid Absorption.description: Whenever the Corrupted Ushabti is subjected to acid damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the acid damage dealt.

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: 被腐化的乌沙比特发动两次攻击，一次使用盾牌，一次使用长剑。

Parry.name: 格挡
Parry.description: 被腐化的乌沙比特在被一次近战攻击命中时，其AC加上 2。此时该乌沙比特必须能看见攻击者，且有在持用一把近战武器或一面盾牌。

Khopesh Slash.name: 克赫帕什镰形刀斩击
Khopesh Slash.description:
近战武器攻击：+9 命中， 触及 5 尺， 单一目标。命中：11 (2d8 + 5) 挥砍伤害。

腐化乌沙比特用它锋利的刀锋攻击。

Arcane Armor.name: Arcane Armor
Arcane Armor.description: The Corrupted Ushabti's body is covered in magical symbols that provide it  extra magical resilience. It is permanently under the effect of the Mage Armor spell.

Imey-er-Sekhrey (Last).name: Imey-er-Sekhrey (Last)
Imey-er-Sekhrey (Last).description: For more about this character, see: @UUID[JournalEntry.cmqoF8Cq3mEIsGPA.JournalEntryPage.DDJCLG51cp0qYvMb]{Biography: Imey-er-Sekhrey (Last)}

Haymaker.name: Haymaker
Haymaker.description:
Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

The Ushabti Captain attacks with its bare fist.

Haste.name: Haste
Haste.description:
Recharge 5-6.

Until the end of its next turn, the Ushabti's body markings glow brightly and it magically gains a +2 bonus to its AC, has advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and can make an additional staff strike as a bonus action.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The Ushabti has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Immutable Form.name: Immutable Form
Immutable Form.description: The Ushabti is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

Acid Absorption.name: Acid Absorption
Acid Absorption.description: Whenever the Ushabti is subjected to acid damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the acid damage dealt.

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The Ushabti Captain makes two attacks, one with its staff and one with its haymaker punch.

Parry.name: 格挡
Parry.description: The Ushabit adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the Ushabti must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

Staff Strike.name: Staff Strike
Staff Strike.description:
Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

The Ushabti Captain attacks with his metal tipped staff.

Arcane Armor.name: Arcane Armor
Arcane Armor.description: The Ushabti's body is covered in magical symbols that provide it  extra magical resilience.

Kesi the Artificer.name: Kesi the Artificer
Kesi the Artificer.description:
Kesi is woman of modest stature but stark appearance. With a shaved head, garb that is a mixture of sky blue vestments, bronze scale armor, an excessive amount of jewelry, and a mace hung from her belt, it is impossible to identify her as any one thing. The countless acessories she wears are made up mostly of charms and icons of the various gods of the lands or mystical symbols, many of which are unfamiliar to contemporary eyes. Her every movement jingles noisily, yet she leaves no footprints where she walks.

To learn more about Kesi's history, personality, and knowledge see @UUID[JournalEntry.cmqoF8Cq3mEIsGPA.JournalEntryPage.0JUK8U1RlyfmxVur]{Biography: Kesi the Divine Artificer}.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description: The priest is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 16, +8 to hit with spell attacks). She can prepare Cleric spells.

Sacred Flame.name: Sacred Flame
Sacred Flame.description:
Flame-like radiance descends on a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d8 Radiant damage. The target gains no benefit from Half Cover or Three-Quarters Cover for this save.

Cantrip Upgrade. The damage increases by 1d8 when you reach levels 5 (2d8), 11 (3d8), and 17 (4d8).

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Cure Wounds.name: 疗伤术
Cure Wounds.description:
A creature you touch regains a number of Hit Points equal to 2d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The healing increases by 2d8 for each spell slot level above 1.

Guiding Bolt.name: Guiding Bolt
Guiding Bolt.description:
You hurl a bolt of light toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, it takes 4d6 Radiant damage, and the next attack roll made against it before the end of your next turn has Advantage.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 1.

Guiding Bolt.name: Guiding Bolt
Guiding Bolt.description: The next attack roll made against the target before the end of your next turn has Advantage.

Sanctuary.name: 庇护术
Sanctuary.description: You ward a creature within range. Until the spell ends, any creature who targets the warded creature with an attack roll or a damaging spell must succeed on a [[/save ability=wis dc=@attributes.spell.dc format=long]] or either choose a new target or lose the attack or spell. This spell doesn't protect the warded creature from areas of effect. The spell ends if the warded creature makes an attack roll, casts a spell, or deals damage.

materials.value: a shard of glass from a mirror

Warded.name: Warded
Warded.description:
Until the spell ends, any creature who targets the warded creature with an attack roll or a damaging spell must succeed on a [[/save ability=wis format=long]] or either choose a new target or lose the attack or spell.

The spell ends if the warded creature makes an attack roll, casts a spell, or deals damage.

Lesser Restoration.name: 次级复原术
Lesser Restoration.description: You touch a creature and end one condition on it: &Reference[blinded], &Reference[deafened], &Reference[paralyzed], or &Reference[poisoned].

Spiritual Weapon.name: Spiritual Weapon
Spiritual Weapon.description:
You create a floating, spectral force that resembles a weapon of your choice and lasts for the duration. The force appears within range in a space of your choice, and you can immediately make one melee spell attack against one creature within 5 feet of the force. On a hit, the target takes Force damage equal to 1d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

As a Bonus Action on your later turns, you can move the force up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for every slot level above 2.

Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
Dispel Magic.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any ongoing spell of level 3 or lower on the target ends. For each ongoing spell of level 4 or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC 10 plus that spell's level). On a successful check, the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You automatically end a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you use.

Spirit Guardians.name: Spirit Guardians
Spirit Guardians.description:
Protective spirits flit around you in a 15-foot Emanation for the duration. If you are good or neutral, their spectral form appears angelic or fey (your choice). If you are evil, they appear fiendish.

When you cast this spell, you can designate creatures to be unaffected by it. Any other creature's Speed is halved in the Emanation, and whenever the Emanation enters a creature's space and whenever a creature enters the Emanation or ends its turn there, the creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 3d8 Radiant damage (if you are good or neutral) or 3d8 Necrotic damage (if you are evil). On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage. A creature makes this save only once per turn.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 3.

Half Speed.name: Half Speed
Half Speed.description: The creature's speed is halved while within the Emanation.

Divine Eminence.name: Divine Eminence
Divine Eminence.description:
As a bonus action, kesi can expend a spell slot to cause her melee weapon attacks to magically deal an extra 10 (3d6) radiant damage to a target on a hit.

This benefit lasts until the end of the turn. If Kesi expends a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage increases by 1d6 for each level above 1st.

Kesi's mace bursts with blinding radiance as it sears her foes.

Ancient Flanged Mace.name: Ancient Flanged Mace
Ancient Flanged Mace.description:
Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage.

Kesi attacks with her ancient flanged mace.

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn't being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Mending.name: Mending
Mending.description:
This spell repairs a single break or tear in an object you touch, such as a broken chain link, two halves of a broken key, a torn cloak, or a leaking wineskin. As long as the break or tear is no larger than 1 foot in any dimension, you mend it, leaving no trace of the former damage.

This spell can physically repair a magic item, but it can't restore magic to such an object.

Healing Word.name: Healing Word
Healing Word.description:
A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains Hit Points equal to 2d4 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The healing increases by 2d4 for each spell slot level above 1.

Prayer of Healing.name: Prayer of Healing
Prayer of Healing.description:
Up to five creatures of your choice who remain within range for the spell's entire casting gain the benefits of a &Reference[shortrest] and also regain 2d8 Hit Points. A creature can't be affected by this spell again until that creature finishes a Long Rest.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The healing increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 2.

Healed by Prayer.name: Healed by Prayer
Healed by Prayer.description: A creature can’t be affected by the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplPrayerofHe] spell again until that creature finishes a Long Rest.

Revivify.name: Revivify
Revivify.description: You touch a creature that has died within the last minute. That creature revives with 1 Hit Point. This spell can't revive a creature that has died of old age, nor does it restore any missing body parts.

materials.value: a diamond worth 300+ GP, which the spell consumes

Guardian of Faith.name: Guardian of Faith
Guardian of Faith.description:
A Large spectral guardian appears and hovers for the duration in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. The guardian occupies that space and is invulnerable, and it appears in a form appropriate for your deity or pantheon.

Any enemy that moves to a space within 10 feet of the guardian for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 20 Radiant damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. The guardian vanishes when it has dealt a total of 60 damage.

Raise Dead.name: Raise Dead
Raise Dead.description:
With a touch, you revive a dead creature if it has been dead no longer than 10 days and it wasn't Undead when it died.

The creature returns to life with 1 Hit Point. This spell also neutralizes any poisons that affected the creature at the time of death.

This spell closes all mortal wounds, but it doesn't restore missing body parts. If the creature is lacking body parts or organs integral for its survival—its head, for instance—the spell automatically fails.

Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The target takes a −4 penalty to D20 Tests. Every time the target finishes a Long Rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it becomes 0.

materials.value: a diamond worth 500+ GP, which the spell consumes

Resurrection Sickness (Day 1).name: Resurrection Sickness (Day 1)
Resurrection Sickness (Day 1).description: Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The target takes a −4 penalty to D20 Tests. Every time the target finishes a Long Rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it becomes 0.

Resurrection Sickness (Day 2).name: Resurrection Sickness (Day 2)
Resurrection Sickness (Day 2).description: Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The target takes a −4 penalty to D20 Tests. Every time the target finishes a Long Rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it becomes 0.

Resurrection Sickness (Day 4).name: Resurrection Sickness (Day 4)
Resurrection Sickness (Day 4).description: Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The target takes a −4 penalty to D20 Tests. Every time the target finishes a Long Rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it becomes 0.

Resurrection Sickness (Day 3).name: Resurrection Sickness (Day 3)
Resurrection Sickness (Day 3).description: Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The target takes a −4 penalty to D20 Tests. Every time the target finishes a Long Rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it becomes 0.

Ancient Scale Mail.name: Ancient Scale Mail
Ancient Scale Mail.description: Mithral is a light, flexible metal. A mithral chain shirt or breastplate can be worn under normal clothes. If the armor normally imposes disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks or has a Strength requirement, the mithral version of the armor doesn't.

Shadowed Steps.name: Shadowed Steps
Shadowed Steps.description: Thanks to powerful magic cast on herself ages ago Kesi makes no sound when she walks, does not leave footprints, and does not suffer disadvantage on Stealth checks due to her armor.

Death Ward.name: Death Ward
Death Ward.description:
You touch a creature and grant it a measure of protection from death. The first time the target would drop to 0 Hit Points before the spell ends, the target instead drops to 1 Hit Point, and the spell ends.

If the spell is still in effect when the target is subjected to an effect that would kill it instantly without dealing damage, that effect is negated against the target, and the spell ends.

Protection from Death.name: Protection from Death
Protection from Death.description:
The first time the target would drop to 0 Hit Points before the spell ends, the target instead drops to 1 Hit Point, and the spell ends.

If the spell is still in effect when the target is subjected to an effect that would kill it instantly without dealing damage, that effect is negated against the target, and the spell ends.

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The mummy makes two [[/item .mmRottingFist000]] attacks and uses [[/item .mmDreadfulGlare0]].

Rotting Fist.name: 腐朽拳击
Rotting Fist.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a creature, it is cursed. While cursed, the target can't regain Hit Points, its Hit Point maximum doesn't return to normal when finishing a Long Rest, and its Hit Point maximum decreases by [[/r 3d6#HP Max Decrease]]{10 (3d6)} every 24 hours that elapse. A creature dies and turns to dust if reduced to 0 Hit Points by this attack.

Cursed.name: Cursed
Cursed.description: If the target is a creature, it is cursed. While cursed, the target can’t regain Hit Points, its Hit Point maximum doesn’t return to normal when finishing a Long Rest, and its Hit Point maximum decreases by [[/r 3d6#HP Max Decrease]]{10 (3d6)} every 24 hours that elapse. A creature dies and turns to dust if reduced to 0 Hit Points by this attack.

Dreadful Glare.name: 恐怖怒视
Dreadful Glare.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=8LmlZfevSQkOxGSN]], one [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=8LmlZfevSQkOxGSN]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=8LmlZfevSQkOxGSN]] feet.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the end of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

Success: The target is immune to this [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s Dreadful Glare for 24 hours.

Frightened.name: Frightened
Frightened.description: The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the end of the attacking creature's next turn.

Nehebkelat, The Demon Queen.name: Nehebkelat, The Demon Queen
Nehebkelat, The Demon Queen.description:
Nehebkelat Quotes

"I see my generals have failed in destroying all of the Eyes of Aten. No matter, the time of ascension is at hand and your order is too late to stop it. It has already begun."

"Consider that we do not have to be enemies. You have bested my generals and proven your worthiness, take their places beside me and we can accomplish incredible things."

"I have had one thousand years to plan your undoing, you will burn like locusts before my flames"

"Your brotherhood and their army of hired 'heroes' were barely enough the first time! An old man and a gaggle of hapless adventurers will not be enough now!"

"I will not spend another thousand years in this hole! You will not succeed!"

"Stop! I will give you riches, power, kingdoms! Anything you desire in the lands are yours if you stand by me as my new generals!"

"Fools! You may have stopped me, but I am eternal! In a thousand years you will not even be memories, and the seals will once again weaken!"

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: Nehebkelat has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Magic Weapons.name: Magic Weapons
Magic Weapons.description: The Demon Queen's weapon attacks are magical.

Reactive.name: Reactive
Reactive.description:
The Demon Queen can take one reaction on every turn in combat. Additionally she gains three new reactions she can use:

  • Parry
  • Venomous Rebuke
  • Punishing Whip

Tail Strike.name: Tail Strike
Tail Strike.description:
Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

If the target is Medium or smaller, it is grappled (escape DC 19). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained. Nehebkelat can automatically hit the target with her tail, but cannot make tail attacks against other targets unless she releases her currently grappled foe.

Nehebkelat lashes out with a coiled tail which reaches across the arena to sieze an unsuspecting foe in its serpentine grasp.

Teleport.name: Teleport
Teleport.description: The Demon Queen magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space she can see.

Parry.name: 格挡
Parry.description:
The Demon Queen adds 5 to her Armor Class against one melee Attack that would hit it. To do so, the marilith must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

The Demon Queen parries your strike with supernatural alacrity.

utility.condition: When targeted by a melee weapon attack.

Slip The Chains.name: Slip The Chains
Slip The Chains.description:
At the end of the Demon Queen's turn, make a Saving throw with disadvantage and a DC of 22. The Save type varies based on the chain/pylon selected. If successful, the chain is instantly deactivated. She can only make this save if she's not incapacitated.

The Demon Queen strains against her magical bonds, roaring with fury and attempting to rip her arm free of the magical bond. The gem on her bracer glows with light and audible creaks can be heard as the magical chains materialize into reality!

Unbroken Shackles.name: Unbroken Shackles
Unbroken Shackles.description:
The number of chains attached to Nehebkelat determine the detrimental effect she suffers:

  • 1-2 Chains: No detrimental effects.
  • 3-4 Chains: Disadvantage on ability checks.
  • 5-6 Chains: Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Curse of Binding.name: Curse of Binding
Curse of Binding.description:
If the Demon Queen has at least one chain still active and anchored she is instantly pulled back toward the center of the arena.

The chains of ancient magic grow taut and forcibly draw the Demon Queen back to the center of her prison!

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The Demon Queen can make seven attacks: six with her various longswords and one with her tail.

Punishing Whip.name: Punishing Whip
Punishing Whip.description:
The attacker is pushed back 10 feet by a heavy impact and must make a Dexterity save or be knocked prone.

If the Demon Queen has a creature grappled she may still use this reaction, but she also releases the grappled creature, throwing them in the same direction as her attacker.

The Demon Queen twists around, lashes out at her foe with her tail!

save.condition: When an enemy creature comes within 10 feet or starts its turn within that area.

Venomous Rebuke.name: Venomous Rebuke
Venomous Rebuke.description:
Her attacker must succeed on a Constitution save or suffer 1d8 Acid and 1d8 Poison damage.

The Demon Queen spits caustic poison in the face of her attacker!

save.condition: When damaged by a creature within 10 feet

Longsword.name: Longsword
Longsword.description:
Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 5) slashing damage.

The Demon Queen attacks with one of her six Longswords.

Elemental Strike.name: Elemental Strike
Elemental Strike.description:
Nehebkelat makes a ranged weapon attack against a single target within 40 feet. On hit, the target takes 6d8 damage.

The Demon Queen may choose the type of damage dealt from the set of pillars which do not currently bind her.

  • Yellow - Thunder
  • Cyan - Lightning
  • Red - Fire
  • Blue - Cold
  • Green - Acid
  • Purple - Force

The Demon Queen sweeps her blades, sending waves of elemental energy from them at the target of her ire!

Elemental Dervish.name: Elemental Dervish
Elemental Dervish.description:
Any creature that isn't incapacitated within 10 feet of the Demon Queen must make a successful Dexterity saving throw or take 6d6 damage.

The Demon Queen may choose the type of damage dealt from the set of pillars which do not currently bind her.

  • Yellow - Thunder
  • Cyan - Lightning
  • Red - Fire
  • Blue - Cold
  • Green - Acid
  • Purple - Force

Note: the measured template for this ability uses a 15 ft. radius to account for Nehebkelat's large base size.

The Demon Queen imbues her blades with chaotic energy and lashes out at all creatures near her.

Elemental Vortex.name: Elemental Vortex
Elemental Vortex.description:
Each creature within the path of the vortex must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 6d4 damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The Demon Queen may choose the type of damage dealt from the set of pillars which do not currently bind her.

  • Yellow - Thunder
  • Cyan - Lightning
  • Red - Fire
  • Blue - Cold
  • Green - Acid
  • Purple - Force

The Demon Queen unleashes a swirling cascade of elemental energy upon her foes, shredding them with chaotic forces.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If Nehebkelat fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description:
Nehebkelat can take 3 legendary actions. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Nehebkelat regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.

  • Elemental Dervish
  • Elemental Strike
  • Elemental Vortex

Nehebkelat can take 3 legendary actions.

Nekhbel-Amun, The Watchful Eye.name: Nekhbel-Amun, The Watchful Eye
Nekhbel-Amun, The Watchful Eye.description:
Hunched over a pile of jars, cooing to them lovingly is the terrible sight of Nekhbel-Amun, the Watchful Eye. He is humanoid, barely, a cross of man and vulture with broad wings from long, thin limbs tipped with sharp talons. In one clawed hand he holds a staff tipped with a radiant gold orb. Upon spotting the group he wraps his wings around himself, hiding it from sight.

Nekhbel-Amun dwells within the Sepulcher of Day - his former prison which is now his proud roost. See @UUID[JournalEntry.n6Fb0D0xskxz4zR4.JournalEntryPage.flzpZlZt8ZTeVBNK]{1j. The Sepulcher of Day} for details on Nekhbel-Amun's encounter, personality, and tactics.

Additional Spells.

Nekhbel-Amun is as greedy for magic and secrets as he is for gems and pretty baubles. Due to this he has collected a vast array of spells which he can bring to bear when necessary. While we simplified his main spellbook for combat, the following list represents additional spells he may have available to use outside of combat, or if the story demands it.

Carrion Caster.name: Carrion Caster
Carrion Caster.description: If a creature is reduced to 0 hit points while in Nekhbel-Amun's lair, he can select a spell from the creature's spell list, adding it to his own. The target does not lose their spell when Nekhbel-amun does this.

Ever-Watchful.name: Ever-Watchful
Ever-Watchful.description: Nekhbel-Amun is immune to being blinded, and has Truesight out to 120 feet.

Scavenge Magic.name: Scavenge Magic
Scavenge Magic.description:
When a character that Nekhbel-Amun can see within 60 ft. loses Concentration on a spell, Nekhbel-amun can seize the threads of magic that were lost and capture that spell for himself, gaining the effect of it until the end of his next turn. This spell does not require his concentration while it lasts.

Nekhbel-amun greedily pulls residual magic from the air, stealing up whatever magic has been recently performed.

Swift Flight.name: Swift Flight
Swift Flight.description: Nekhbel-amun launches himself to a new perch up to 60 feet away, ignoring rough terrain and passing through creature's squares without provoking opportunity attacks.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description: Nekhbel-Amun is a 13th-level spellcaster. Their spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 18, +10 to hit with spell attacks).

Scepter of the Sun.name: Scepter of the Sun
Scepter of the Sun.description:
Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage and 3 (1d6) radiant damage.

Nekbhel-Amun attempts to bludegeon you with his wooden staff topped with a glimmering gold orb!

Talon.name: Talon
Talon.description:
Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage.

Nekhbel-Amun rakes at you with his avian talons.

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: Nekhbel-Amun attacks two times, once with his staff and once with his talons.

Hex.name: Hex
Hex.description:
You place a curse on a creature that you can see within range. Until the spell ends, you deal an extra 1d6 Necrotic damage to the target whenever you hit it with an attack roll. Also, choose one ability when you cast the spell. The target has Disadvantage on ability checks made with the chosen ability.

If the target drops to 0 Hit Points before this spell ends, you can take a Bonus Action on a later turn to curse a new creature.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. Your Concentration can last longer with a spell slot of level 2 (up to 4 hours), 3–4 (up to 8 hours), or 5+ (24 hours).

materials.value: the petrified eye of a newt

Bonus Hex Damage.name: Bonus Hex Damage
Bonus Hex Damage.condition: whenever you hit the target with an attack roll

Hexed Strength.name: Hexed Strength
Hexed Strength.description: The target has Disadvantage on ability checks made with the chosen ability.

Hexed Dexterity.name: Hexed Dexterity
Hexed Dexterity.description: The target has Disadvantage on ability checks made with the chosen ability.

Hexed Constitution.name: Hexed Constitution
Hexed Constitution.description: The target has Disadvantage on ability checks made with the chosen ability.

Hexed Intelligence.name: Hexed Intelligence
Hexed Intelligence.description: The target has Disadvantage on ability checks made with the chosen ability.

Hexed Wisdom.name: Hexed Wisdom
Hexed Wisdom.description: The target has Disadvantage on ability checks made with the chosen ability.

Hexed Charisma.name: Hexed Charisma
Hexed Charisma.description: The target has Disadvantage on ability checks made with the chosen ability.

Counterspell.name: Counterspell
Counterspell.description: You attempt to interrupt a creature in the process of casting a spell. The creature makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the spell dissipates with no effect, and the action, Bonus Action, or Reaction used to cast it is wasted. If that spell was cast with a spell slot, the slot isn't expended.

activation.condition: when you see a creature within range casting a spell with Verbal, Somatic, or Material components

Banishment.name: Banishment
Banishment.description:
One creature that you can see within range must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be transported to a harmless demiplane for the duration. While there, the target has the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition. When the spell ends, the target reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.

If the target is an Aberration, a Celestial, an Elemental, a Fey, or a Fiend, the target doesn't return if the spell lasts for 1 minute. The target is instead transported to a random location on a plane (DM's choice) associated with its creature type.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 4.

Banished.name: Banished
Banished.description:
While there, the target has the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition. When the spell ends, the target reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.

If the target is an Aberration, a Celestial, an Elemental, a Fey, or a Fiend, the target doesn’t return if the spell lasts for 1 minute. The target is instead transported to a random location on a plane (DM’s choice) associated with its creature type.

Eyebite.name: Eyebite
Eyebite.description:
For the duration, your eyes become an inky void. One creature of your choice within 60 feet of you that you can see must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be affected by one of the following effects of your choice for the duration.

On each of your turns until the spell ends, you can take a Magic action to target another creature but can't target a creature again if it has succeeded on a save against this casting of the spell.

Asleep. The target has the &Reference[Unconscious apply=false] condition. It wakes up if it takes any damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

Panicked. The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition. On each of its turns, the Frightened target must take the &Reference[Dash] action and move away from you by the safest and shortest route available. If the target moves to a space at least 60 feet away from you where it can't see you, this effect ends.

Sickened. The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition.

affects.special: cannot target a creature that has succeeded on a save against this casting

Asleep.description: The target has the &Reference[Unconscious apply=false] condition. It wakes up if it takes any damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.
